items.content_html:
Summary

According to w3 docs about role="grid" in Keyboard Interaction For Layout Grids (sorry, there are no anchor links) section focus can actully move in Layout grids (but not in Data grids):

  • ➡️: Moves focus one cell to the right. Optionally, if focus is on the right-most cell in the row, focus may move to the first cell in the following row. If focus is on the last cell in the grid, focus does not move.
  • ⬅️: Moves focus one cell to the left. Optionally, if focus is on the left-most cell in the row, focus may move to the last cell in the previous row. If focus is on the first cell in the grid, focus does not move.
  • ⬇️: Moves focus one cell down. Optionally, if focus is on the bottom cell in the column, focus may move to the top cell in the following column. If focus is on the last cell in the grid, focus does not move.
  • ⬆️: Moves focus one cell up. Optionally, if focus is on the top cell in the column, focus may move to the bottom cell in the previous column. If focus is on the first cell in the grid, focus does not move.

And since the calendar's demo is a Layout grid, I've updated the left and right key interaction as it is in w3 calendar's demo.

Motivation

More detailed info, right now it looks like we can't move focus at all for both grid types in dead ends.

Supporting details

  1. w3 docs with keyboard interaction sections for both types of grids
  2. w3 layout grids examples
  3. w3 data grids examples
  4. w3 calendar's demo (as layout grid)

Related issues

Metadata

  • Adds a new document
  • Rewrites (or significantly expands) a document
  • Fixes a typo, bug, or other error
items.title: [Role: Grid] More information about keyboard interactions

items.content_html: Used the Microsoft Docs Authoring Pack VScode plugin to remove the locales from the Microsoft links. They do this to make translations easier, since the locale-less links are redirected to the users locale automatically.
items.title: fix: remove locales from Microsoft links

items.title: fix: MD036 emphasis used instead of a heading

items.content_html:
Description:
This PR adds details for OffscreenCanvasRenderingContext2D. The approach for documenting this interface is to minimize duplication, adding an index.md document for the OffscreenCanvasRenderingContext2D object that references methods and properties that it inherits instead of adding new pages:

tree

/files/en-us/web/api/offscreencanvasrenderingcontext2d/index.md
├── commit
│   └── index.md
└── index.md # mostly references /files/en-us/web/api/canvasrenderingcontext2d

Depends on:

  • #19859

TODO:

  • Link to the web-worker example mdn/dom-examples#159

Parent task:

  • #11591
items.title: 11591 OffscreenCanvasRenderingContext2D

items.content_html:
Summary

For we may going to deprecate Compat/Specifications macro parameters, we should
update the documentation about multiple BCD tables querying (for this feature has already been supported by mdn/yari#6465).

Metadata

  • Rewrites (or significantly expands) a document
items.title: require multiple BCD tables by specifying `browser-compat` as an array

items.content_html:
at first glance it looks like the dragenter event was missed, then it's celar you put only dragover on both cases to show that you can cancel the even by employing ether way, I just aim to make it so the codeblobk guides more by including both necessary events.
